body_html:
Thanks @betanalpha for your in-depth comment!

I agree with most of your points. However, I think incorporating structure such as conditional independence is crucial. It's certainly crucial "for scaling statistical computation" (see, for example, the many works on scalable MCMC: Bardenet et al., 2015; Angelino et al., 2016; Andrieu and Roberts, 2009; Welling and Teh, 2011; Chen et al., 2014; Gelman et al., 2014; Maclaurin and Adams, 2014). Whether you believe in data subsampling is another thing (Betancourt, 2015), but I'm not sure if there are good alternative solutions.

@alexggmatthews: Having a standalone HMC algorithm in TensorFlow would be awesome. To avoid becoming part of a higher-level API, its scope has to be deliberately designed, both in what extensions it allows and what it limits.
